channel.title: Help me decide between these two laptops
channel.description:
Alright, having a really hard choice. My current laptop is falling apart. I have the opportunity to buy my mom's laptop that she used from school which is less than a year old, for $130. I'll list off the specs between the two, please help me decided.
Problems with my current laptop..
[ul][li]Webcam cord has been ripped.[/li] [li]Screen is falling apart, tape all around it.[/li] [li]Left side hinge for the screen isn't even connected anymore.[/li] [li]Left and down arrow keys don't work, which is a big hassle when it comes to programming.[/li] [li]F3 key is missing.[/li] [li]Several screws missing from around the laptop.[/li][/ul]
Specs for my current laptop: Acer 5810TZ (five years old) Installed RAM: 3GB Installed OS: Windows 7 (x64) Screen Size: 15.6-Inch Screen Resolution: 1366 x 768 Processor: [b]Single Core[/b] - 1.3 GHZ Pentium. Memory Speed: 1066MHz HDD: 320GB Graphics card RAM size: 1,759MB Battery Life: 8 Hours
Specs for the possible (new) laptop: Gateway NE52207u (less than a year old) Installed RAM: 4GB Installed OS: Windows 8.1 (x64) Screen size: 16-inch Screen Resolution: 1366 x 768 Processor: [b]Dual Core[/b] - 1.4GHz AMD HDD: 750GB Graphics Card RAM Size: ~700mb Battery Life: 4.5hrs
Those are the specs on the two, my current laptop doubles the battery life of the new one, and almost triples RAM allocated for the graphics card. The new one has +1GB of RAM, Windows 8.1 (which I'll probably downgrade to 7), +.4 inches in screen size, Dual core + faster processor speed, extra 250GB space..
Plus the new one doesn't have all the problems that my old one does.
Suggestions guys? I need a reliable laptop for work, as I'm on the go a lot of the time and I'm not taking my desktop computer to my girlfriends house. Here are full spec sheets:
My current laptop - [url=http://www.amazon.com/Acer-Aspire-Timeline-AS5810TZ-4274-15-6-Inch/dp/B002AURXTY#productDetails]Amazon[/url] Possible new laptop - [url=http://www.pcworld.com/product/1275996/gateway-ne52207u-12504g75nsk-notebook.html]PCWorld[/url]

item.title: Help me decide between these two laptops
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:11, topic:544308”][quote author=Ashi link=topic=663188.msg4433350#msg4433350 date=1404218118]
chrome book
[/quote]

If you want to browse the internet and check your email/watch videos and what not, a ChromeBook would be perfect and inexpensive. But I need a full, not-metered laptop. And those of you who are posting 2k USD laptops, that’s not really in my budget. The only thing that’s holding me back from upgrading to this other laptop is that the graphics card is a third of what my current one is. :([/quote]
I have no problem with webdev on my chromebook. Use a service like nitrous.io or c9.io

As far as the graphics card goes, both of those laptops do not have a dedicated gpu, so what Windows reports as usable vram isn’t something to judge by.

Read full topic
item.source: Help me decide between these two laptops

item.title: Help me decide between these two laptops
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:12, topic:544308”][quote author=The Web Guy link=topic=663188.msg4433605#msg4433605 date=1404259672]

chrome book

If you want to browse the internet and check your email/watch videos and what not, a ChromeBook would be perfect and inexpensive. But I need a full, not-metered laptop.
[/quote]
You can use word, powerpoint etc., play games, program etc. What are you looking to do?[/quote]
Hmm, didn’t know ChromeBooks could do that also. I watch a lot of videos, torrent a lot of stuff, program, play some games, etc. But the only OS that I will ever use is Windows.

Read full topic
item.source: Help me decide between these two laptops

item.title: Help me decide between these two laptops
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

[quote=“xxx123xxx, post:8, topic:544308”][quote author=ox random xi link=topic=663188.msg4433240#msg4433240 date=1404179333]

Intel Core i7-4700HQ 2.4 GHz (6 MB Cache)
16 GB DDR3L SDRAM
1 TB 7200 rpm Hard Drive, 128 GB Solid-State Drive
15.6-Inch Screen, NVIDIA Geforce GTX860M with 2GB GDDR5 VRAM
Windows 8.1

Amazon
[/quote]also, this is what i’m picking up for college. it’s a beast.

My buddy had the exact same one, the hard drive started failing and there was a problem with the charging port on the back (basically you had to position the plug in just right or it will not charge).[/quote]
This could be better, I’m still researching for a decent laptop too.
Amazon

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

Pwnd:

I wonder where you’ll be finding a Macbook for $130.

That’s the thing. My grandpa is retiring soon and he offered me his Macbook Pro. But I hate Macintosh, I can’t find my way around in the OS.

item.title: Help me decide between these two laptops
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

Alright, having a really hard choice. My current laptop is falling apart. I have the opportunity to buy my mom’s laptop that she used from school which is less than a year old, for $130. I’ll list off the specs between the two, please help me decided.

Problems with my current laptop…

[ul][li]Webcam cord has been ripped.[/li]
[li]Screen is falling apart, tape all around it.[/li]

[li]F3 key is missing.[/li]
[li]Several screws missing from around the laptop.[/li][/ul]

Specs for my current laptop:
Acer 5810TZ (five years old)
Installed RAM: 3GB
Installed OS: Windows 7 (x64)
Screen Size: 15.6-Inch
Screen Resolution: 1366 x 768
Processor: Single Core - 1.3 GHZ Pentium.
Memory Speed: 1066MHz
HDD: 320GB
Graphics card RAM size: 1,759MB
Battery Life: 8 Hours

Specs for the possible (new) laptop:
Gateway NE52207u (less than a year old)
Installed RAM: 4GB
Installed OS: Windows 8.1 (x64)
Screen size: 16-inch
Screen Resolution: 1366 x 768
Processor: Dual Core - 1.4GHz AMD
HDD: 750GB
Graphics Card RAM Size: ~700mb
Battery Life: 4.5hrs

Those are the specs on the two, my current laptop doubles the battery life of the new one, and almost triples RAM allocated for the graphics card. The new one has +1GB of RAM, Windows 8.1 (which I’ll probably downgrade to 7), +.4 inches in screen size, Dual core + faster processor speed, extra 250GB space…

Plus the new one doesn’t have all the problems that my old one does.

Suggestions guys? I need a reliable laptop for work, as I’m on the go a lot of the time and I’m not taking my desktop computer to my girlfriends house. Here are full spec sheets:

My current laptop - Amazon
Possible new laptop - PCWorld
